intro: Palala sublanceolata, commonly known as the narrow leaf palala, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
